verses.kjv: Furthermore David the king said unto all the congregation, Solomon my son, whom alone God hath chosen, is yet young and tender, and the work is great: for the palace is not for man, but for the LORD God.
verses.web: David the king said to all the assembly, “Solomon my son, whom alone God has chosen, is yet young and tender, and the work is great; for the palace is not for man, but for LORD God.
verses.ct: King David addressed the entire assembly: "My son Solomon is the one God has chosen, but he's still young and inexperienced. The task ahead of him is enormous — this temple isn't being built for any human being, but for the LORD God."

verses.kjv: Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for things to be made of gold, and the silver for things of silver, and the brass for things of brass, the iron for things of iron, and wood for things of wood; onyx stones, and stones to be set, glistering stones, and of divers colours, and all manner of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.
verses.web: Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for the things of gold, the silver for the things of silver, the bronze for the things of bronze, iron for the things of iron, and wood for the things of wood; also onyx stones, stones to be set, stones for inlaid work, of various colors, all kinds of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.
verses.ct: "I've done everything in my power to gather materials for the house of my God: gold for the gold items, silver for the silver items, bronze for the bronze items, iron for the iron items, and wood for the wood items. I've also gathered onyx stones, stones for settings, stones for inlaid work in every color, all kinds of precious stones, and marble in abundance."

verses.kjv: Moreover, because I have set my affection to the house of my God, I have of mine own proper good, of gold and silver, which I have given to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house,
verses.web: In addition, because I have set my affection on the house of my God, since I have a treasure of my own of gold and silver, I give it to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house,
verses.ct: "Beyond all that, because I love the house of my God so deeply, I'm giving from my own personal treasury of gold and silver — on top of everything I've already set aside for the holy temple."

verses.kjv: Even three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, to overlay the walls of the houses withal:
verses.web: even three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, with which to overlay the walls of the houses;
verses.ct: "This includes 3,000 talents of gold from Ophir and 7,000 talents of refined silver, to overlay the walls of the temple buildings."

verses.kjv: The gold for things of gold, and the silver for things of silver, and for all manner of work to be made by the hands of artificers. And who then is willing to consecrate his service this day unto the LORD?
verses.web: of gold for the things of gold, and of silver for the things of silver, and for all kinds of work to be made by the hands of artisans. Who then offers willingly to consecrate himself today to LORD?”
verses.ct: "Gold for the gold work, silver for the silver work, and materials for every kind of project the craftsmen will carry out. Now — who else is willing to give generously to the LORD today?"

verses.kjv: Then the chief of the fathers and princes of the tribes of Israel, and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the rulers of the king’s work, offered willingly,
verses.web: Then the princes of the fathers’ households, and the princes of the tribes of Israel, and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the rulers over the king’s work, offered willingly;
verses.ct: The leaders of the family clans, the tribal leaders of Israel, the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and the officials in charge of the king's projects all stepped forward and gave willingly.

verses.kjv: And gave for the service of the house of God of gold five thousand talents and ten thousand drams, and of silver ten thousand talents, and of brass eighteen thousand talents, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
verses.web: and they gave for the service of God’s house of gold five thousand talents and ten thousand darics, of silver ten thousand talents, of bronze eighteen thousand talents, and of iron one hundred thousand talents.
verses.ct: For the service of God's house, they contributed 5,000 talents and 10,000 darics of gold, 10,000 talents of silver, 18,000 talents of bronze, and 100,000 talents of iron.

verses.kjv: And they with whom precious stones were found gave them to the treasure of the house of the LORD, by the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
verses.web: People with whom precious stones were found gave them to the treasure of LORD’s house, under the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
verses.ct: Anyone who had precious stones donated them to the treasury of the LORD's house, placed under the care of Jehiel the Gershonite.

verses.kjv: Then the people rejoiced, for that they offered willingly, because with perfect heart they offered willingly to the LORD: and David the king also rejoiced with great joy.
verses.web: Then the people rejoiced, because they offered willingly, because with a perfect heart they offered willingly to LORD; and David the king also rejoiced with great joy.
verses.ct: The people were overjoyed because of how freely everyone gave — they had offered willingly to the LORD with wholehearted devotion. King David was filled with great joy as well.

verses.kjv: Wherefore David blessed the LORD before all the congregation: and David said, Blessed be thou, LORD God of Israel our father, for ever and ever.
verses.web: Therefore David blessed LORD before all the assembly; and David said, “You are blessed, LORD, the God of Israel our father, forever and ever.
verses.ct: Then David praised the LORD in front of the entire assembly. He said, "You are blessed, LORD, God of Israel our father, forever and ever."

verses.kjv: Thine, O LORD, is the greatness, and the power, and the glory, and the victory, and the majesty: for all that is in the heaven and in the earth is thine; thine is the kingdom, O LORD, and thou art exalted as head above all.
verses.web: Yours, LORD, is the greatness, the power, the glory, the victory, and the majesty! For all that is in the heavens and in the earth is yours. Yours is the kingdom, LORD, and you are exalted as head above all.
verses.ct: "Yours, LORD, is the greatness, the power, the glory, the victory, and the majesty! Everything in the heavens and on the earth belongs to you. Yours is the kingdom, LORD, and you are exalted as head above all."

verses.kjv: Both riches and honour come of thee, and thou reignest over all; and in thine hand is power and might; and in thine hand it is to make great, and to give strength unto all.
verses.web: Both riches and honor come from you, and you rule over all! In your hand is power and might! It is in your hand to make great, and to give strength to all!
verses.ct: "Riches and honor come from you, and you rule over everything. In your hand are power and might. It's in your hand to make anyone great and to give strength to all."

verses.kjv: Now therefore, our God, we thank thee, and praise thy glorious name.
verses.web: Now therefore, our God, we thank you, and praise your glorious name.
verses.ct: "So now, our God, we thank you and praise your glorious name."

verses.kjv: But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly after this sort? for all things come of thee, and of thine own have we given thee.
verses.web: But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly as this? For all things come from you, and we have given you of your own.
verses.ct: "But who am I, and who are my people, that we should be able to give so freely like this? Everything comes from you — we're only giving back what you first gave us."

verses.kjv: For we are strangers before thee, and sojourners, as were all our fathers: our days on the earth are as a shadow, and there is none abiding.
verses.web: For we are strangers before you, and foreigners, as all our fathers were. Our days on the earth are as a shadow, and there is no remaining.
verses.ct: "We are strangers and foreigners in your sight, just as all our ancestors were. Our days on this earth pass like a shadow, and nothing here lasts."

verses.kjv: O LORD our God, all this store that we have prepared to build thee an house for thine holy name cometh of thine hand, and is all thine own.
verses.web: LORD our God, all this store that we have prepared to build you a house for your holy name comes from your hand, and is all your own.
verses.ct: "LORD our God, all this wealth we've gathered to build a house for your holy name — it came from your hand, and it all belongs to you."

verses.kjv: I know also, my God, that thou triest the heart, and hast pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of mine heart I have willingly offered all these things: and now have I seen with joy thy people, which are present here, to offer willingly unto thee.
verses.web: I know also, my God, that you try the heart, and have pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of my heart I have willingly offered all these things. Now I have seen with joy your people, who are present here, offer willingly to you.
verses.ct: "I know, my God, that you test the heart and take pleasure in integrity. With an honest heart, I've given all of this willingly. And now I've watched with joy as your people who are gathered here have given willingly to you."

verses.kjv: O LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and of Israel, our fathers, keep this for ever in the imagination of the thoughts of the heart of thy people, and prepare their heart unto thee:
verses.web: LORD, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, our fathers, keep this desire forever in the thoughts of the heart of your people, and prepare their heart for you;
verses.ct: "LORD, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our ancestors — keep this desire alive forever in the hearts of your people, and turn their hearts toward you."

verses.kjv: And give unto Solomon my son a perfect heart, to keep thy commandments, thy testimonies, and thy statutes, and to do all these things, and to build the palace, for the which I have made provision.
verses.web: and give to Solomon my son a perfect heart, to keep your commandments, your testimonies, and your statutes, and to do all these things, and to build the palace, for which I have made provision.”
verses.ct: "And give my son Solomon a wholehearted devotion to keep your commandments, your testimonies, and your statutes — to carry out all of this and to build the temple that I've made provision for."

verses.kjv: And David said to all the congregation, Now bless the LORD your God. And all the congregation blessed the LORD God of their fathers, and bowed down their heads, and worshipped the LORD, and the king.
verses.web: Then David said to all the assembly, “Now bless LORD your God!” All the assembly blessed LORD, the God of their fathers, and bowed down their heads and prostrated themselves before LORD and the king.
verses.ct: Then David said to the whole assembly, "Now praise the LORD your God!" The entire assembly praised the LORD, the God of their ancestors. They bowed their heads and worshiped the LORD and honored the king.

verses.kjv: And they sacrificed sacrifices unto the LORD, and offered burnt offerings unto the LORD, on the morrow after that day, even a thousand bullocks, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, with their drink offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel:
verses.web: They sacrificed sacrifices to LORD, and offered burnt offerings to LORD, on the next day after that day, even one thousand bulls, one thousand rams, and one thousand lambs, with their drink offerings and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel,
verses.ct: The next day, they offered sacrifices and burnt offerings to the LORD: 1,000 bulls, 1,000 rams, and 1,000 lambs, along with their drink offerings and many other sacrifices on behalf of all Israel.

verses.kjv: And did eat and drink before the LORD on that day with great gladness. And they made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and anointed him unto the LORD to be the chief governor, and Zadok to be priest.
verses.web: and ate and drank before LORD on that day with great gladness. They made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and anointed him before LORD to be prince, and Zadok to be priest.
verses.ct: They ate and drank before the LORD that day with tremendous joy. Then they crowned Solomon son of David as king for the second time, anointing him before the LORD as ruler, and they anointed Zadok as priest.

verses.kjv: Then Solomon sat on the throne of the LORD as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him.
verses.web: Then Solomon sat on the throne of LORD as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him.
verses.ct: Solomon then took his seat on the LORD's throne as king in place of his father David. He prospered, and all Israel gave him their loyalty.

verses.kjv: And all the princes, and the mighty men, and all the sons likewise of king David, submitted themselves unto Solomon the king.
verses.web: All the princes, the mighty men, and also all of the sons of king David submitted themselves to Solomon the king.
verses.ct: Every official, every warrior, and all of King David's other sons pledged their allegiance to King Solomon.

verses.kjv: And the LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and bestowed upon him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
verses.web: LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and gave to him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
verses.ct: The LORD elevated Solomon to extraordinary greatness in the eyes of all Israel, giving him a royal majesty that no king of Israel before him had ever known.

verses.kjv: Thus David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
verses.web: Now David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
verses.ct: David son of Jesse had reigned over all Israel.

verses.kjv: And the time that he reigned over Israel was forty years; seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned he in Jerusalem.
verses.web: The time that he reigned over Israel was forty years; he reigned seven years in Hebron, and he reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: He ruled Israel for a total of 40 years — 7 years in Hebron and 33 years in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honour: and Solomon his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: He died at a good old age, full of days, riches, and honor; and Solomon his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: He died at a ripe old age, having lived a full life rich in years, wealth, and honor. His son Solomon reigned after him.

verses.kjv: Now the acts of David the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of Samuel the seer, and in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the book of Gad the seer,
verses.web: Now the acts of David the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the history of Samuel the seer, and in the history of Nathan the prophet, and in the history of Gad the seer,
verses.ct: Everything about King David's reign, from beginning to end, is recorded in the writings of Samuel the seer, the writings of Nathan the prophet, and the writings of Gad the seer.

verses.kjv: With all his reign and his might, and the times that went over him, and over Israel, and over all the kingdoms of the countries.
verses.web: with all his reign and his might, and the times that went over him, and over Israel, and over all the kingdoms of the countries.
verses.ct: These accounts cover his entire reign and his mighty deeds, along with the events that shaped his life, the nation of Israel, and all the surrounding kingdoms.
